items.title: Ukraine skeleton racer disqualified from Olympics over memorial helmet
items.standfirst: Ukrainian skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych was disqualified from the Winter Olympics by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) on Thursday for his insistance on wearing a helmet depicting Ukrainian sportsmen and women killed during the war with Russia. The IOC said that the athlete had not adhered to its "athlete expression guidelines".

clusters.title: US Pam Bondi faces backlash over release of Epstein documents

items.title: US Pam Bondi faces backlash over release of Epstein documents
items.standfirst: US Attorney General Pam Bondi faced intense questioning over the handling of Jeffrey Epstein files after documents released victims’ personal information while redacting many alleged abusers’ names. Bondi denied wrongdoing but faced criticism from both Democrats and some Republicans.
items.content: US Attorney General Pam Bondi faced intense questioning over the handling of Jeffrey Epstein files after documents released victims’ personal information while redacting many alleged abusers’ names. Bondi denied wrongdoing but faced criticism from both Democrats and some Republicans.

items.title: US Attorney General Bondi deflects questions, clashes with democrats over Epstein files
items.standfirst: US Attorney General Pam Bondi on Wednesday forcefully defended her department's handling of the files related to convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, an issue that has dogged her tenure. With victims of Epstein seated behind her, Bondi tried to deflect from relentless criticism by mocking her Democratic questioners and praising Trump over the performance of the stock market.
items.content: US Attorney General Pam Bondi on Wednesday forcefully defended her department's handling of the files related to convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, an issue that has dogged her tenure. clusters.title: 'Dawson's Creek' star James Van Der Beek dies at 48
clusters.neutral_headline: James Van Der Beek Dies At 48

items.title: 'Dawson's Creek' star James Van Der Beek dies at 48
items.standfirst: US actor James Van Der Beek, the star of the American TV series "Dawson's Creek," died on Wednesday at age 48 after a battle with colorectal cancer. "Our beloved James David Van Der Beek passed peacefully this morning. He met his final days with courage, faith, and grace," read a post on his Instagram page. Van Der Beek, who was married and had six children, announced his cancer diagnosis in 2024.
items.content: US actor James Van Der Beek, the star of the American TV series "Dawson's Creek," died on Wednesday at age 48 after a battle with colorectal cancer. "Our beloved James David Van Der Beek passed peacefully this morning. He met his final days with courage, faith, and grace," read a post on his Instagram page. Van Der Beek, who was married and had six children, announced his cancer diagnosis in 2024.

clusters.title: 2026 Olympics: Golden day for France's Simon and ice dancing duo Cizeron, Fournier Beaudry

items.title: 2026 Olympics: Golden day for France's Simon and ice dancing duo Cizeron, Fournier Beaudry
items.standfirst: It was a banner day for Team France on February 11, 2026 at the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics. In the women's 15km individual biathlon, Julia Simon claimed gold ahead of teammate Lou Jeanmonnot, who took silver. In moguls, Perrine Laffont grabbed bronze, eight years after her Pyeongchang triumph. The highlight came on the ice, where Laurence Fournier Beaudry and Guillaume Cizeron won Olympic gold in figure skating.
items.content: It was a banner day for Team France on February 11, 2026 at the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics. In the women's 15km individual biathlon, Julia Simon claimed gold ahead of teammate Lou Jeanmonnot, who took silver. In moguls, Perrine Laffont grabbed bronze, eight years after her Pyeongchang triumph. The highlight came on the ice, where Laurence Fournier Beaudry and Guillaume Cizeron won Olympic gold in figure skating.

items.title: Madison Chock and Evan Bates claim silver in ice dance at 2026 Winter Olympics
items.standfirst: Madison Chock and Evan Bates claimed a silver medal at the 2026 Winter Olympics on Wednesday following a stunning free dance routine.
items.content: Madison Chock and Evan Bates claimed a silver medal at the 2026 Winter Olympics on Wednesday following a stunning free dance routine.

items.title: France’s Cizeron, Fournier Beaudry win ice dance gold at 2026 Olympics
items.standfirst: French figure skaters Guillaume Cizeron and Laurence Fournier Beaudry won Olympic gold in ice dance on Wednesday, capping a remarkable rise after pairing up just one year ago. The duo topped reigning world champions Madison Chock and Evan Bates of the United States following the free dance final.
items.content: French figure skaters Guillaume Cizeron and Laurence Fournier Beaudry won Olympic gold in ice dance on Wednesday, capping a remarkable rise after pairing up just one year ago. The duo topped reigning world champions Madison Chock and Evan Bates of the United States following the free dance final.

items.standfirst: Marc Benioff’s remarks criticized as employees were reportedly planning to urge him to cancel business with agencyMarc Benioff, the Salesforce CEO and co-founder, is facing growing criticism over a joke he made about US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) monitoring international employees during an event for the company.Employees publicly expressed outrage about Benioff’s comments in his keynote address at an internal conference in Las Vegas on Tuesday, and leaders at Slack, which Salesforce owns, have said he should apologize.
